algorithm_technique: Sliding window to count vowels in substrings of fixed length k.
problem_summary_simple: Find the substring of a given length with the most vowels.
problem_summary_technical: Use a sliding window to efficiently count vowels, updating the count as the window moves across the string.
key_insights: A sliding window is ideal for problems involving fixed-size contiguous subarrays/substrings.
Maintain a running count of vowels and adjust it by adding the new character and subtracting the outgoing character.
A set for vowels provides O(1) average time complexity for checking if a character is a vowel.
